title: Brusy-Jaglie
text:
Brusy-Jaglie () is a <a href="village">village</a> in the administrative district of <a href="Gmina%20Brusy">Gmina Brusy</a>, within <a href="Chojnice%20County">Chojnice County</a>, <a href="Pomeranian%20Voivodeship">Pomeranian Voivodeship</a>, in northern Poland. It lies approximately west of <a href="Brusy">Brusy</a>, north-east of <a href="Chojnice">Chojnice</a>, and south-west of the regional capital <a href="Gda%C5%84sk">Gdańsk</a>. Here was born <a href="J%C3%B3zef%20Che%C5%82mowski">Józef Chełmowski</a> - a Kashubian <a href="folk-sculptor">folk-sculptor</a>.
For details of the history of the region, see "<a href="History%20of%20Pomerania">History of Pomerania</a>".
The village has a population of 159.
References.
